recipe_name: Grilled haggis 'koftas' with yoghurt, mint and lime dressing
author: Richard Phillips
method: For the haggis koftas, place all the ingredients, except the olive oil, in a food processor and pulse until combined.  Soak four wooden skewers in a bowl of water for about 20 minutes to prevent them from burning.  Shape the haggis mixture around the skewers and rub with the oil. Heat a griddle pan until hot and cook the koftas until browned on all sides and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. For the dressing, place all the dressing ingredients into a bowl and mix well. Serve the koftas on a plate with the dressing in a bowl on the side.
ingredients: Â½ cooked haggis, chopped,  1 tsp ground ginger,  1 tsp chilli powder,  1 tsp ground turmeric,  1 tsp ground coriander,  1 free-range egg,  1 tbsp plain flour,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  1 tbsp olive oil,  4 tbsp plain yoghurt,  1 tbsp chopped fresh chives,  1 tbsp chopped fresh mint,  1 lime, zest and juice,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
